data.title: Opening directory with spaces and trailing slash opens invalid file
data.body:
### Prerequisites

* [x] Put an X between the brackets on this line if you have done all of the following:
    * Reproduced the problem in Safe Mode: http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#using-safe-mode
    * Followed all applicable steps in the debugging guide: http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/
    * Checked the FAQs on the message board for common solutions: https://discuss.atom.io/c/faq
    * Checked that your issue isn't already filed: https://github.com/issues?utf8=âœ“&q=is%3Aissue+user%3Aatom
    * Checked that there is not already an Atom package that provides the described functionality: https://atom.io/packages

### Description

If you attempt to open a directory using a path with spaces in it, and include the trailing `\`, Atom opens to the parent directory with an empty "file" of the directory name with a `"` on the end.

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Have a directory with a directory that has spaces in the name as one of it's parent folders.
    * For example: `C:\foo bar\foo`
2. From the CLI (`cmd.exe` or PowerShell) attempt to open the folder with a trailing slash in the command.
    * For example: `atom 'C:\Temp\foo bar\foo\'`
3. Note that Atom has opened the _parent_ folder, with the desired folder name open as a "file" with an `"` on the end.
    * For example: Atom open to `C:\foo bar` with an empty "file" of `foo"` open.

**Expected behavior:**

Atom opens the desired folder, regardless of whether there was a trailing `\` on the path.

**Actual behavior:**

Atom opens the _parent_ folder, with an empty file named after the desired folder with a `"` on the end open.

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/427137/25925238/38cb37c8-359c-11e7-9b06-3f58f081a577.png)
_The window on the left is the behavior of the first command, the window on the right is the second command (and the expected behavior)._

**Reproduces how often:**

100% of the time.

### Versions

Tested on Windows 10 x64 on:
```
Atom    : 1.17.0-beta5
Electron: 1.3.15
Chrome  : 52.0.2743.82
Node    : 6.5.0
```

Also tested on:
```
Atom    : 1.18.0-dev-fb9fd2fbf
Electron: 1.3.15
Chrome  : 52.0.2743.82
Node    : 6.5.0
```
(A build based on https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/14372/commits/fb9fd2fbfcf2f6fa07f43efcde20d4ee109df6a4)

### Additional Information

I tested the following variations...

Working:
* Anything that doesn't have the `\`, or doesn't have a space in any parent folder

Failing under both PowerShell and old fashioned `cmd.exe`:
* `PS C:\Temp> atom '.\foo bar\foo\'`
* `PS C:\Temp> atom 'C:\Temp\foo bar\foo\'`
* `PS C:\Temp> atom "C:\Temp\foo bar\foo\"`

data.title: Act on active center items only when saving and closing
data.body:
This PR changes the behavior of the save and close commands to only act on the active item in the *center* of the workspace, rather than including items in docks.

This *could* be slightly confusing in some cases, such as if a user drags an editor or other save-able/closeable item into a dock, but ultimately treating dock items the same as center items for saving and closing has proven to be more confusing than helpful.

/cc @matthewwithanm @BinaryMuse @smashwilson @lee-dohm

data.title: Downgrade text-buffer to see if it helps our integration tests on CI
Migrate squirrel-update to JS
data.body:
### Description of the Change
Blocked on a fix for https://github.com/atom/joanna/issues/5 (in progress)

This PR migrates `squirrel-update.coffee` to modern JS via Babel - unlike some of my past migration attempts, this time around I'm gonna try migrating individual files in their own PRs instead of all bundled into one to try to keep the cost of review and risk of merge conflicts low.

### Possible Drawbacks
This could introduce some bugs into the updater on Windows, but I didn't run into anything from my testing.

ðŸ‘€ @atom/feedback

data.title: Editor changes screen upon update restart
data.body:
On mac (10.12.4 (16E195) ) when you restart Atom because of plug-in update it does not restore the window into the last position. My editor window is running on a large attached monitor and when I restart it, it opens up a smaller editor window on the laptop screen. 

Atom version: 1.16.0

data.title: Uncaught TypeError: decorationIterator.getCloseScopeIds is not a function
data.body:
Newly built Atom-Dev, upon first load I received `Uncaught TypeError: decorationIterator.getCloseScopeIds is not a function` for Autocomplete-plus, then notifications, then settings-view package, etc... 

**Steps**: 
1. clone repo [eea036750]
2. script/build --code-sign --install (node 6.10.2, npm 3.10.10)
3. open Atom

**Atom**: 1.18.0-dev-eea036750 x64
**Electron**: 1.3.15
**OS**: Mac OS X 10.12.4
**Thrown From**: Atom Core


### Stack Trace

Uncaught TypeError: decorationIterator.getCloseScopeIds is not a function

```
At /Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app/node_modules/text-buffer/lib/screen-line-builder.js:213

TypeError: decorationIterator.getCloseScopeIds is not a function
    at ScreenLineBuilder.emitDecorationBoundaries (/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app/node_modules/text-buffer/lib/screen-line-builder.js:213:1)
    at ScreenLineBuilder.buildScreenLines (/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app/node_modules/text-buffer/lib/screen-line-builder.js:121:1)
    at DisplayLayer.getScreenLines (/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app/node_modules/text-buffer/lib/display-layer.js:630:1)
    at TextEditorPresenter.<anonymous> (/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app/src/text-editor-presenter.js:1371:1)
    at TextEditorPresenter.module.exports.TextEditorPresenter.updateLines (/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app/src/text-editor-presenter.js:1378:1)
    at TextEditorPresenter.module.exports.TextEditorPresenter.getPreMeasurementState (/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app/src/text-editor-presenter.js:123:1)
    at TextEditorComponent.module.exports.TextEditorComponent.updateSyncPreMeasurement (/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app/src/text-editor-component.js:266:1)
    at TextEditorComponent.module.exports.TextEditorComponent.updateSync (/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app/src/text-editor-component.js:198:1)
    at new TextEditorComponent (/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app/src/text-editor-component.js:172:1)
    at atom-text-editor.TextEditorElement.mountComponent (/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app/src/text-editor-element.js:203:24)
    at atom-text-editor.TextEditorElement.setModel (/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app/src/text-editor-element.js:147:12)
    at atom-text-editor.TextEditorElement.initialize (/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app/src/text-editor-element.js:133:12)
    at TextEditor.module.exports.TextEditor.getElement (/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app/src/text-editor.js:3332:1)
    at ViewRegistry.module.exports.ViewRegistry.createView (/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app/src/view-registry.js:100:1)
    at ViewRegistry.module.exports.ViewRegistry.getView (/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app/src/view-registry.js:88:1)
    at atom-pane.PaneElement.getActiveView (/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app/src/pane-element.js:198:25)
    at atom-pane.<anonymous> (/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app/src/pane-element.js:53:55)
```

### Commands

```
 27x -9:49.5.0 core:copy (atom-notification.fatal.icon.icon-bug.native-key-bindings.has-detail.has-close.has-stack)
```

### Non-Core Packages

```
N/A
```

data.title: Add configuration for probot-stale
data.body:
### Requirements

* Filling out the template is required. Any pull request that does not include enough information to be reviewed in a timely manner may be closed at the maintainers' discretion.
* All new code requires tests to ensure against regressions

### Description of the Change

Add configuration for the [probot-stale integration](https://github.com/probot/stale) to automatically close issues that have not had any recent activity. Currently set to notify issues that haven't had any activity in two years and then close if it still doesn't have activity in an additional 30 days after being notified.

### Alternate Designs

Have been doing this kind of thing manually :cry:

### Why Should This Be In Core?

This is project configuration, not adding anything to the Atom application.

### Benefits

Not having to clean up old issues manually.

### Possible Drawbacks

Might close issues that we still want to remain open but we will be tracking the stale label to ensure that doesn't happen.

### Applicable Issues

N/A

data.title: Uncaught TypeError: decorationIterator.getCloseScopeIds is not a function
data.body:
<!--

Have you read Atom's Code of Conduct? By filing an Issue, you are expected to comply with it, including treating everyone with respect: https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md

Do you want to ask a question? Are you looking for support? The Atom message board is the best place for getting support: https://discuss.atom.io

-->

### Prerequisites

* [x] Put an X between the brackets on this line if you have done all of the following:
    * Reproduced the problem in Safe Mode: http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#using-safe-mode
    * Followed all applicable steps in the debugging guide: http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/
    * Checked the FAQs on the message board for common solutions: https://discuss.atom.io/c/faq
    * Checked that your issue isn't already filed: https://github.com/issues?utf8=âœ“&q=is%3Aissue+user%3Aatom
    * Checked that there is not already an Atom package that provides the described functionality: https://atom.io/packages

### Description

Atom is failing to launch and leaving the following stack in the console:

```
<embedded>:112032 Uncaught (in promise) TypeError: decorationIterator.getCloseScopeIds is not a function
    at ScreenLineBuilder.emitDecorationBoundaries (/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app/node_modules/text-buffer/lib/screen-line-builder.js:213:1)
    at ScreenLineBuilder.buildScreenLines (/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app/node_modules/text-buffer/lib/screen-line-builder.js:121:1)
    at DisplayLayer.getScreenLines (/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app/node_modules/text-buffer/lib/display-layer.js:630:1)
    at TextEditorPresenter.<anonymous> (/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app/src/text-editor-presenter.js:1371:1)
    at TextEditorPresenter.module.exports.TextEditorPresenter.updateLines (/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app/src/text-editor-presenter.js:1378:1)
    at TextEditorPresenter.module.exports.TextEditorPresenter.getPreMeasurementState (/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app/src/text-editor-presenter.js:123:1)
    at TextEditorComponent.module.exports.TextEditorComponent.updateSyncPreMeasurement (/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app/src/text-editor-component.js:266:1)
    at TextEditorComponent.module.exports.TextEditorComponent.updateSync (/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app/src/text-editor-component.js:198:1)
    at new TextEditorComponent (/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app/src/text-editor-component.js:172:1)
    at atom-text-editor.TextEditorElement.mountComponent (/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app/src/text-editor-element.js:203:24)
    at atom-text-editor.TextEditorElement.setModel (/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app/src/text-editor-element.js:147:12)
    at atom-text-editor.TextEditorElement.initialize (/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app/src/text-editor-element.js:133:12)
    at TextEditor.module.exports.TextEditor.getElement (/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app/src/text-editor.js:3332:1)
    at ViewRegistry.module.exports.ViewRegistry.createView (/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app/src/view-registry.js:100:1)
    at ViewRegistry.module.exports.ViewRegistry.getView (/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app/src/view-registry.js:88:1)
    at atom-pane.PaneElement.activeItemChanged (/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app/src/pane-element.js:136:29)
    at Pane.module.exports.Pane.observeActiveItem (/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app/src/pane.js:259:1)
    at atom-pane.PaneElement.initialize (/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app/src/pane-element.js:103:41)
    at Pane.module.exports.Pane.getElement (/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app/src/pane.js:94:1)
    at ViewRegistry.module.exports.ViewRegistry.createView (/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app/src/view-registry.js:100:1)
    at ViewRegistry.module.exports.ViewRegistry.getView (/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app/src/view-registry.js:88:1)
    at atom-pane-container.module.exports.PaneContainerElement.rootChanged (/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app/src/pane-container-element.js:41:27)
    at Function.module.exports.Emitter.simpleDispatch (/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app/node_modules/event-kit/lib/emitter.js:25:1)
    at Emitter.module.exports.Emitter.emit (/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app/node_modules/event-kit/lib/emitter.js:141:1)
    at PaneContainer.setRoot (/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app/src/pane-container.js:135:1)
    at PaneContainer.deserialize (/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app/src/pane-container.js:55:1)
    at WorkspaceCenter.deserialize (/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app/src/workspace-center.js:30:1)
    at Workspace.deserialize (/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app/src/workspace.js:414:1)
    at AtomEnvironment.module.exports.AtomEnvironment.deserialize (/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app/src/atom-environment.js:1227:1)
    at /Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app/src/atom-environment.js:815:1
```

### Steps to Reproduce

Open Atom on a project directory that contains saved state:

```
$ atom .
```

The problem also occurs in safe mode. Using `--clear-window-state` suppresses it for that run, but it reappears immediately afterward.

**Expected behavior:** Atom should launch successfully and display the tree view and background tips, restore saved state, and so on.

**Actual behavior:** Window remains blank and there's an exception in the console.

**Reproduces how often:** 100% on workspaces that were serialized recently (within the last day or so), never on workspaces that I haven't opened for a while.

### Versions

MacOS Sierra, 10.12.4

```
$ atom --version
Atom    : 1.18.0-dev-5d57ecb8c
Electron: 1.3.15
Chrome  : 52.0.2743.82
Node    : 6.5.0
$ apm --version
apm  1.18.1
npm  3.10.10
node 6.9.5 x64
python 2.7.13
git 2.12.2
```

### Additional Information

I'd guess that this is just an incompatible change in the way that editor state is serialized to IndexDB, but I'm suspicious because it reoccurs after a `--clear-window-state`.

data.title: Fix `PaneContainer::onDidStopChangingActivePaneItem()`
data.body:
We we're allowing subscription to this event, but never actually triggering it ðŸ˜¨

This is mostly copypasta from the implementation in workspace. lmk if you'd prefer something different.

I also added a test for `onDidChangeActivePane()` which I can separate into another commit if you want or drop entirely. (I was attempting to repro the other part of #14369 but it seems to work for me.)

cc @BinaryMuse @nathansobo

data.title: ðŸŽ‰
data.body:
itshappening.gif

---

For posterity: In addition to some more exciting changes âœ¨, this PR makes some changes to the way we run tests. In particular, if a core package has an `atomTestRunner` entry in it's `package.json`, we now perform the following operations:

1. Copy the package's `node_modules` to `node_modules.bak`
2. Run `apm install` inside the package folder to install all its devDependencies
3. Run the tests as usual
4. Remove the new `node_modules` folder and rename `node_modules.bak` to `node_modules`

This ensures that all test dependencies get installed, while also ensuring that we don't corrupt CI's `node_modules` cache.

data.title: Uncaught TypeError: Cannot read property 'querySelector' of null ---((( INFINITY LOOP OF ERROR MESSAGES )))
data.body:
[Enter steps to reproduce:]

1. ... Error: variables outputs as key, not as value. For example:
```
$oscuro #263238
$pink #F50057
$claro #fff

body
	background-color $oscuro
	color $claro
```
outputs that:
```
body {
  background-color: $oscuro;
  color: $claro;
}
```

data.title: Atom 1.17.0-beta5 - onDidChangeActivePane and onDidStopChangingActivePaneItem on atom.workspace.getCenter() do not work.
data.body:
<!--

Have you read Atom's Code of Conduct? By filing an Issue, you are expected to comply with it, including treating everyone with respect: https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md

Do you want to ask a question? Are you looking for support? The Atom message board is the best place for getting support: https://discuss.atom.io

-->

### Prerequisites

* [X] Put an X between the brackets on this line if you have done all of the following:
    * Reproduced the problem in Safe Mode: http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#using-safe-mode
    * Followed all applicable steps in the debugging guide: http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/
    * Checked the FAQs on the message board for common solutions: https://discuss.atom.io/c/faq
    * Checked that your issue isn't already filed: https://github.com/issues?utf8=âœ“&q=is%3Aissue+user%3Aatom
    * Checked that there is not already an Atom package that provides the described functionality: https://atom.io/packages

### Description

`atom.workspace.getCenter().onDidChangeActivePane` and `atom.workspace.getCenter().onDidStopChangingActivePaneItem` do not work.

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Open up Dev tools.
2. Type in either `atom.workspace.getCenter().onDidStopChangingActivePaneItem(console.log)` or `atom.workspace.getCenter().onDidChangeActivePane(console.log)`.
3. Switch tabs in center dock, observe that nothing is logged in the console.

**Expected behavior:** [What you expect to happen]
It should log the new pane that is active.

**Actual behavior:** [What actually happens]
Nothing is logged.

**Reproduces how often:** [What percentage of the time does it reproduce?]
100% of the time.

### Versions

Atom 1.17.0-beta5
MacOS 10.12.4

### Additional Information

These two event handlers work on the workspace itself via `atom.workspace.onDidStopChangingActivePaneItem(console.log)` or `atom.workspace.onDidChangeActivePane(console.log)`.

I'm looking to use these methods for my [tree-view-extended](https://github.com/hswolff/tree-view-extended) package.

data.title: Ensure that win_delay_load_hook.cc is included in the bundled app
data.body:
### Description of the Change

The file `src/win_delay_load_hook.cc` is required for node_gyp to build native dependencies on Windows. This overrides the exclusion of `*.cc` and `*.h` sources from the packaged app for this specific, odd case, allowing native dependency builds to succeed again.

### Alternate Designs

I tried to find a way to modify the existing regexp to prevent `EXCLUDED_PATHS_REGEXP` from matching this file, but unfortunately JavaScript doesn't support negative lookbehind and I was concerned about the risk of an explosion in computational complexity with the workarounds.

I also considered splitting the `*.(cc|h)` exclusion rule into more specific exclusion rules, but there are too many of each that we _do_ want to exclude (all of the others; currently about 375 *.cc and 1000 *.h files). That would also cause a maintenance issue when adding any new dependencies with native components in the future.

### Why Should This Be In Core?

That's where the build scripts are :wink:

### Benefits

Attempting to build native dependencies on Windows machines fails with an error containing the following:

```
c1xx : fatal error C1083: Cannot open source file: 'C:\Users\foo\AppData\Local\Atom x64\app-dev\resources\app\apm\node_modules\node-gyp\src\win_delay_load_hook.cc': No such file or directory [C:\Users\foo\Documents\GitHub\xyz\node_modules\keytar\build\keytar.vcxproj]
```

These builds now succeed.

### Possible Drawbacks

Juggling multiple inclusion and exclusion patterns with precedence can quickly gets confusing (see: .gitignore files).

### Applicable Issues

My previous attempt to fix this was in atom/apm#716, merged in atom/atom#14331.

data.title: Prepack javascript to reduce startup time
data.body:
This might be another great way to reduce startup time:  https://prepack.io/

I know you already capture the V8 state for core modules, but you could use this to make third-party packages load faster.

data.title: Snippets take longer to load in larger files
data.body:
### Description

When using snippets in large files, the snippet dropdown takes a noticeably longer period of time to appear.

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Open a large file (over 1000 lines seems to do it for me)
2. Use a snippet
3. Observe that the snippet dropdown appears after a delay

**Expected behavior:** Snippet dropdown should open immediately

**Actual behavior:** Snippet dropdown takes a few seconds to appear

**Reproduces how often:** Every time I use a snippet in a large file

### Versions

```shell
$ atom --version
Atom    : 1.16.0
Electron: 1.3.13
Chrome  : 52.0.2743.82
Node    : 6.5.0

$ apm --version
apm  1.16.1
npm  3.10.5
node 6.9.5 x64
python 2.7.12
git 2.11.0
```

### Additional Information

I can understand why autocomplete in general would take a while to load, but snippets shouldn't need to read the whole file to load -- they should appear immediately.

data.title: "Search in Directory" no longer appears in the context menu when right-clicking on project tree entries
data.body:
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/187210/25758275/e7a10e6c-319b-11e7-900f-1ce71eb31308.png)

Somewhere in the last 2-4 weeks, my "Search in directory" option has disappeared from the context menu on the project tree.

This featured heavily in my workflow, I use it constantly throughout the day. Opening the global search with ctrl+shift+f is tedious because it forces users to manually type their search scope.

Was it intentionally removed or did it disappear as a regression?

Is there a way to re-enable it?


Versions:

Atom    : 1.17.0-beta4
Electron: 1.3.15
Chrome  : 52.0.2743.82
Node    : 6.5.0

data.title: 1.17.0-Beta4 - Syntax highlighting fails on large flies
data.body:
### Prerequisites

* [X] Put an X between the brackets on this line if you have done all of the following:
    * Reproduced the problem in Safe Mode: http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#using-safe-mode
    * Followed all applicable steps in the debugging guide: http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/
    * Checked the FAQs on the message board for common solutions: https://discuss.atom.io/c/faq
    * Checked that your issue isn't already filed: https://github.com/issues?utf8=âœ“&q=is%3Aissue+user%3Aatom
    * Checked that there is not already an Atom package that provides the described functionality: https://atom.io/packages

### Description

Large files do not show syntax highlighting, I have tried multiple files with more than 150,000 lines and no matter what I do it will not highlight the text correctly. I have found if you cut all the text out of the file, then past it into a new file, scroll to the top, it will highlight correctly (but not once you save and open the file again). The only way I can get the highlight to work consistently is when I physically shrink the file to ~50k lines.

### Steps to Reproduce

1. [First Step]
Open a large C, Java, XML, or some other syntax aware file (150,000 lines or more)
2. [Second Step]
Note that the text has no syntax highlighting even though the correct language is detected

**Expected behavior:** [What you expect to happen]
When opening a large text files (150k+ lines) the text is highlighted correctly based on the selected syntax.
**Actual behavior:** [What actually happens]
All text has no highlighting, only when shrinking the file to ~50k lines did highlighting start to function again.
**Reproduces how often:** [What percentage of the time does it reproduce?]
100%

### Versions
1.17.0-Beta4 c64
Windows 7 x64

### Additional Information

data.title: Loading a big project with SPELL-CHECK" on freezes Atom.
data.body:
I have a big project folder with a few hundreds of files, after looking at TIMECOP, it says that on a BLANK start it takes 406ms just to load, after spell-ckeck 0.71.3 is disabled, blank startup falls to 38ms.

With Spell-Check on, it simply freezes, i've left it loading for about 5 minutes and no response.
